page.title: 10St.Andrew's Church
page.content: The church was built between 750 and 825 AD but by 875 AD the Danes had burnt it down. The church was rebuilt and now has a fine Saxon arch and Saxon windows. The south and north aisles and chancel were added at a later date and the spire dates from 1200 AD. A resident priest is mentioned in the Doomsday Book. The living was in the gift of the Crown but is now the patronage of the Bishop of Peterborough. People come to see this church because of its great age and because there is evidence of various styles of building, right up to the Elizabethan period. For instance the turret and base tower and great arch remain intact from the Anglo-Saxon church of 900 AD. The present seating was installed in 1873, every summer there is a flower festival which attracts many visitors.
